gen

Class BoolFunc

  • java.lang.Object
    • gen.BoolFunc

  • public class BoolFunc
extends java.lang.Object
    A class of static methods used in word generation that operate on 2D boolean arrays Credit to the people at Rogue Basin for some concepts and code samples
    Author:
    Ryan Luchs

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_PERCENT_TRUE
      A percentage that produces fairly open levels with no cut off rooms when using cellular automata

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BoolFunc() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean[][] cellularAutomaton(int columns, int rows, int percentTrue)
      Generateds a patterned boolean[][] by use of a cellular automaton algorithm Cellular Automata are used to produce more organic looking distributions This algorithm runs for four iterations This method uses Cartographer's random object
      static boolean[][] fill(boolean[][] array, boolean fillState)
      Fills a boolean[][] with the specified value
      static boolean[][] invert(boolean[][] array)
      Inverts every value of a boolean[][] (value = !value)
      static boolean[][] randomWalk(int columns, int rows, int step, int percentTrue)
      Generates a patterned boolean[][] by use of a random walk algorithm Random produce maps with long interconnected grid like corridors This method uses Cartogrpaher's random object

        public static boolean[][] invert(boolean[][] array)
        Inverts every value of a boolean[][] (value = !value)
        Parameters:
        array - The array
        Returns:
        The modified array

      • randomWalk

        public static boolean[][] randomWalk(int columns,
                     int rows,
                     int step,
                     int percentTrue)
        Generates a patterned boolean[][] by use of a random walk algorithm Random produce maps with long interconnected grid like corridors This method uses Cartogrpaher's random object
        Parameters:
        columns - The map length
        rows - The map height
        step - The length of each "step" of the walk
        percentTrue - The percentage of tiles that should be "true" at the end if the alk does not cross over its own path
        Returns:
        The map as a boolean[][]

      • cellularAutomaton

        public static boolean[][] cellularAutomaton(int columns,
                            int rows,
                            int percentTrue)
        Generateds a patterned boolean[][] by use of a cellular automaton algorithm Cellular Automata are used to produce more organic looking distributions This algorithm runs for four iterations This method uses Cartographer's random object
        Parameters:
        columns - The map length
        rows - The map height
        percentTrue - Percentage of map covered by "true" cells at initialization
        Returns:
        The map as a boolean[][]
